text:
As part of National Productivity Week celebrations observed across the country from February 12 to 18, a seminar on “Ease of doing business for higher productivity and sustainable growth” was held at Salem Productivity Council here recently.

Chief guest T. Palanikumar, Chief Divisional Retail Manager of Indian Oil Corporation, Salem, said that introduction of power card by IOC has yielded good results to the extent of converting 36 per cent of the fuel purchase by their clients as complementary services to them. P. Thangavelu, Deputy General Manager and Circle Head to the lead Bank Indian Bank detailed about various financial advances that the bank is offering to promote industries and increasing economical growth in Salem and Namakkal districts. He said that the bank is concentrating on cluster development and the potential industries identified for growth are coir, sago and textiles.

Staff Reporter
title: Productivity Week celebrated
